_thread_replies.text: <@U01AKGWGLC8> yeah, all our metric tools are JS-based so if it fails, we have no way to track those errors. What we can is to monitor "missing traffic" as Pame suggested.

elements.text: yeah, all our metric tools are JS-based so if it fails, we have no way to track those errors. What we can is to monitor "missing traffic" as Pame suggested.

_thread_replies.text:
here is a query we built with Pame - <https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/datasets/traces-frontend-live/result/rw4PyqvKg8e?vs=timeshiftOverlay&cs_0=omitMissingValues>

_thread_replies.text: it's intermittent

Ok, so it seems to be the same old problem of having a new deployment - at this point, the assets that belong to old deployments stop existing and you can't get them anymore if you are in the middle of something (like loading a page).
I thought we should have this issue fixed after moving to Vercel, but seems we didn't because it requires some extra functionality turned on and it costs some money that we decided not to pay :dunno:

elements.text:
Ok, so it seems to be the same old problem of having a new deployment - at this point, the assets that belong to old deployments stop existing and you can't get them anymore if you are in the middle of something (like loading a page).
I thought we should have this issue fixed after moving to Vercel, but seems we didn't because it requires some extra functionality turned on and it costs some money that we decided not to pay

_thread_replies.text: I'm checking Cloudflare logs to see if we can see any spikes of 404s

elements.text: I'm checking Cloudflare logs to see if we can see any spikes of 404s

_thread_replies.text: Looks like on average, there are around 1k failed requests to JS assets a day. The rate seems stable (apart from some spike last weekend)

elements.text: Looks like on average, there are around 1k failed requests to JS assets a day. The rate seems stable (apart from some spike last weekend)

_thread_replies.text: Looking at the last 24 hours though doesn't give a clear picture of 404s spiking during working hours (and more frequent deployments) :thinking_face:

elements.text: Looking at the last 24 hours though doesn't give a clear picture of 404s spiking during working hours (and more frequent deployments)

messages.text:
Hello :wave:

We're substituting the Good Chop Support Slack Workflow (that green button we had) to the Slack Commander :robot_face:

From now on, please use `/new_issue` or `/new_question` to submit your support request to our squad and fill up the form. We will get back to you as soon as possible as always. Same as before but with a new, well-known, and more powerful tool.

Thank you! :goodchop_fan:

elements.text: We're substituting the Good Chop Support Slack Workflow (that green button we had) to the Slack Commander

to submit your support request to our squad and fill up the form. We will get back to you as soon as possible as always. Same as before but with a new, well-known, and more powerful tool.

Thank you!
